item.title: Report E-2025020194
item.description:
Report E-2025020194

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-15T03:17:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-13
  • City: PEMBROKE PINES
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On February 13, 2025, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN1760 released approximately twenty (20) gallons of product to the trailer interior and pavement below. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from American Safety, LLC (AS) to remediate the site. AS personnel utilized hand tools, absorbents, and soda ash to remediate the impacted impacted trailer and pavement. One (1) 55-gallon drum of UN1760 was placed into one (1) 95-gallon poly over-pack, and all spent absorbents, PPE, and cleanup debris were containerized into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On February 13, 2025, four (4) 5-gallon pails of paint were damaged and released approximately six (6) gallons of paint to the trailer interior and dock floor. R+L retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroServe (ES) to remediate the site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to containerize waste in one (1) 55-gallon drum. The damaged pails were overpacked in one (1) 55-gallon drum.

item.title: Report E-2025020191
item.description:
Report E-2025020191

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-15T03:17:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-12
  • City: COLONIAL HEIGHTS
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On February 12, 2025, one (1) 600-pound pressurized tank of UN3500 was crushed in transit and released approximately 5-ounces of product to the dock floor and pallet. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel utilized hand tools and absorbents to remediate the UN3500-impacted loading dock floor. After remediating the product released on the pallet and loading dock, the crew utilized a forklift to move the leaking tank into an open well ventilated area. The damaged tank was labeled with a non-haz waste label and all impacted material was collected and containerized into two (2) 55-gallon drums.

  • Description: On February 12, 2025, one (1) 275-gallon tote of UN2735 was damaged and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the trailer interior and dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Marion Environmental Inc. (MEI) to remediate the site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to collect all product into one (1) 55-gallon drum. The contents from the damaged drum were transferred into one (1) new 275-gallon tote for further shipment.

item.title: Report E-2025020195
item.description:
Report E-2025020195

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-15T03:17:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-11
  • City: MIAMI
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: DURING SCREENING PROCESS OF A PREBUILT UNIT AAY13143UPS OFFERED TO UPS AIR CARGO SERVICES IN MIAMI, FLORIDA GOING TO COLOMBIA WE DISCOVERED ONE BLACK SHRINK WRAPPED SKID INSIDE THE CONTAINER THAT CONTAINED FIVE BOXES WITH GROUND LIMITED QUANTITY MARKS. CONTENT INSPECTION OF THE LIMITED QUANTITY BOXES REVEALED KIRKLAND EXTRA STRENGTH FOR MEN MINOXIDIL TOPICAL SOLUTIONS USP, 5%. DANGEROUS GOODS ARE PROHIBITED IN ALL SHIPPER PREBUILT UNITS. AN INVESTIGATION WITH THE SHIPPER IS ONGOING.

item.title: Report I-2025010003
item.description:
Report I-2025010003

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-15T00:55:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-29
  • City: SEADRIFT
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: DOW Chemical-Watco Yard
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 11/29/24 at approximately 23:00 conductor notified !he yardmaster on duty that they had located a leaking Anhydrous Ammonia rail car, STPX 220216. Yardmaster immediately had the crew clear the area and escalated to DOW EH&S who responded and attempted to secure the car and stop the leak. EH&S was unable to stop the leak and Specialized Response Solutions was contacted for remediation. SRS arrived on scene and began to work on the leak. The vapor valve was found to be leaking through the bonnet and the secondary closure plug after being unloaded and moved to a storage yard. Dow's Emergency Response Team responded and attempted to repair the leak by tightening the valve handle but found that the handle was stripped. The valve handle was removed to be replaced by another valve handle. After removal of the stripped handle the valve stem was found to be rounded off. This prevented the addition of closure pressure without gouging the valve shaft. The response team used a 24-inch pipe wrench and was able to apply a small amount of force that only minimally affected the leak volume through the bonnet. The Dow ER team was considering installing the Midland Emergency Response Kit (ERK) but the protective housing only had three port holes therefore the capping kit strongback would not connect properly. SRS crew returns to the tank car to construct and install a vapor scrubber and install a containment bag over the vapor valve. The internal pressure of the car is approximately 85 psig. The two-tote vapor scrubber is set up and operational. While the crew was preparing to place a containment bag over the vapor valve the decision was made to loosen the valve faceplate and release the pressure contained in the body of the valve. This would simplify the installation of the containment bag over the vapor valve. Crew removes the vapor valve faceplate. Minimal pressure is heard leaking through the sealing surface of the valve. The crew find that the seat disc (gasket) installed in the seat disc retainer assembly has been partially dislodged. The seat disc has been crushed by force being applied to the valve stem. Without removal of all pressure from the tank car the leak would not be repaired Crew attempted to install the capping kit gasket between the vapor valve and the magnetic gauging rod flange assembly. Although the gasket would not fit the crew decided to shave the side of the gasket and try again with no success. Decision made to remove the magnetic gauging rod flange and shave one quarter inch off the edge of the flange facing the vapor valve. The nuts securing the protective housing outer ring are removed and the outer ring is rotated 90 degrees to provide port holes for the capping kit strong back. Midland capping kit is successfully installed. As pressure in the can increases the pressure is sent to the scrubber while seating the gasket confirming containment. This is being done due to the defective sealing surface and corrosion on the surface of the

item.title: Report I-2024120044
item.description:
Report I-2024120044

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-15T00:55:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-18
  • City: BURLINGTON
  • State: MA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: QSA GLOBAL, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 11/18/2024 at 13:40 pm, QSA Global, Inc. received an undeclared hazardous material shipment from Samsung Vietnam on behalf of Neadtech, JSC. The outer packaging was a shrink-wrapped cardboard box designed to contain a rice cooker. It was suspected that this package may contain a radioactive container. It was moved to the "Radioactive Shipping/Receiving" area of the facility. Upon opening the package, it was discovered that the package contained a modified Type A Model 650L source changer with a depleted Se-75 source (0.12 Ci). The rice cooker box did not contain the proper DOT required markings/labels for radioactive material or for an overpack. The Model 650L had no radiation labeling present, was painted red and the nameplate was not visible due to the paint. The paint mimicked the coloring of the rice cooker pictured on the outer packaging. Neadtech, JSC neither forwarded the 7 Day Advance Notification Form (F-C-3190-002) to QSA Global, Inc. as required for approval of an import of radioactive material, nor informed QSA Global, Inc. of the returning shipment. Radiation Surveys of the Model 650L were within regulatory limits, and no contamination was present. There was no release and no failure of the package other than the unlawful modification and incorrect shipment classification & labeling. Please note for ques. 25 on this form, there are no failure codes associated with RAM packages within the DOT Incident Form F 5800.1 instructions.

  • Description: A 30 gallon metal drum of lighters was being shipped under special permit 13179. At the time of the incident the drum was on a pallet and had been removed from a 48' van trailer and was to be moved from one pallet to another to be placed back on the 48' van trailer for further transportation. There was no other handling to take place. As an employee grabbed the drum by hand to move it the lid blew off hitting the employee. There was no continued release of butane. The butane that had accumulated in the drum did flash and it is estimated that all the butane was used in the flash. No release, nor continued release of butane was observed. A single butane torch appears to have been defective and caused the incident. As the lighters were being repackaged a butane torch was ignited just by moving it. The lock was found to be defective. The torch was made inoperable by taping the valve closed.

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-22
  • City: Clifton

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: BRENNTAG NORTHEAST, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 1
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 13250000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: BNE Driver was involved in fatal vehicle accident while traveling east bound on NJ Route 3 (Clifton, NJ), -Lat 40.8673383, Long -74.184025479. At the time of the accident the EE was driving BNE tractor #476 and loaded BNE van trailer #159. After coming in contact with a NJ Transit Bus, the vehicle went off the right side of the roadway, struck the guardrail, and went through a sound barrier wall creating a fire engulfing the tractor, spreading to the trailer, and resulted in fire and two explosions of onboard hazmat (various flammable liquids, and corrosive) freight. The EE succumbed to their injuries. Roadway was closed for several hours and Local Clifton Fire Dept was able to extinguish the fire of the vehicle, trailer and freight. First Call Environmental (ER/Environmental) contractor was able to contain, remediate, and clean-up the affected areas impacted by fire and release of hazmat at direction of EPA and NJDEP.

item.title: Report I-2024070112
item.description:
Report I-2024070112

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-15T00:55:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-17
  • City: RIVERDALE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: EAST PENN LOGISTICS LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 1
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 313220
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: An East Penn Manufacturing Co. driver was heading west bound on Kamm Ave approaching Jameson Ave. The other driver was headed northbound on Jameson Ave. approaching Kamm Ave. The other driver disregarded the posted stop sign and came into the path of the East Penn driver. Collision occurred and the East Penn truck rolled on to its side and came to a final stop at the northwest corner of the intersection. This was a T-Bone event. Police came to the scene and requested help for the cleanup. East Penn hired a hazardous waste cleanup contractor to clean up the batteries that were on the ground and take them back to their shop. East Penn then went back to the contractor to pick up the batteries to take them back to East Penn's Salt Lake City, UT facility. The batteries were then sent to one of the East Penn's tolling smelters for proper disposal of the batteries at a secondary lead smelter for recycle. East Penn also hired a contractor to do the remediation cleanup of the soil and incident area. The clean up was completed and overseen by the Fresno County Enviromental Health.

R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the site. The crew utilized neutralizers and absorbents to remediate the site. All waste and the damaged pail were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum.

THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER PACKAGING. THE SHIPPER INFORMATION ON THE THERMAL TRACKING LABEL DOES NOT HAVE A FULL SHIPPER ADDRESS VISIBLE. THE PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER X837V1, OMH, 1035 CONGER ST, EUGENE OR 97402-6938. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

  • Description: PACKAGE WAS BROUGHT BACK TO DMP PROCESSING AREA IN SPILL TRAY. RESPONDER SAW WAS A PACKAGE WITH CORROSIVE 8 AND OXIDIZER 5.1 LABELS. READ DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEETS FOR BOTH. ADDED SILVER SHIELD LINERS TO INSIDE OF GLOVES. SOLIDIFIED LIQUIDS WITH ZEP ZORBENT AND THEN TESTED WITH PH TAPE. WAS NOT WITHIN 6-9 RANGE SO ADDED SODIUM BICARBONATE TILL MIXTURE WAS NOT AN ALKALINE OR BASE. READ WASTE DISPOSAL CHART AND PROCESSED THROUGH THE DMP. AFTER PROCESSING, REFERRED TO DECONTAMINATION CHECKLIST.

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 8500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO contacted ERTS regarding a smoking and leaking tote containing hazardous material, Ethylenediamine. A contractor dispatched and observed an estimated 1-ounce release onto the top of a tote from a defective bung cap. Upon further investigation, the contractor determined that the seal on the cap was damaged along with the threads. They replaced the cap and performed a slosh test. The tote passed and will ship on to the Consignee. No waste was generated from the incident. No storm-drains, waterways or soil were involved.

item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-13T06:18:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-23
  • City: LOWELL
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) gallon of material released from one (1) 1-gallon metal pails due to improperly loaded freight that resulted in the pail leaking. The released material impacted the trailer floor and three other pails. Dayton Freight personnel deployed absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 5-gallon metal drum. Another one (1) 5-gallon metal drum was also used to contain the impacted pails. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

  • Description: At approximately 7:34 PM on 01/18/25 oit was reported that tank car CGTX 31196 was leaking when the car was moved, the car was isolated in our track 48 at North Yard until we could contact the shipper. The shipper was contacted on 01/19/25 and requested we use pur Haz-Mat Contractor Haz-Mat Special Services to repair and clean. They determined that the swing bolts were not tightened properly resulting the leak, they corrected the issues and cleaned the car.

item.title: Report E-2025020129
item.description:
Report E-2025020129

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-13T06:18:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-17
  • City: SANTA FE SPRINGS
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 16500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics Terminal ULA experienced a release of UN1830 AcidPro S93 from a 55-gallon poly drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 40-gallons of product spilled due to a pallet nail puncture. The material impacted a 25' x 8' area of the trailer floor, and the concrete lot below in areas measuring 25' x 7 and 30' x 20'. Soda ash and absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted areas. All impacted absorbents, neutralizer, pallet pieces, PPE, impacted debris, and the damaged original drum were collected and containerized into (11) poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

A small amount of product was detected on the side of the car under the platform grating as was as along the lip of the Multi-Housing Nozzle and cover. The shipper Dow/R&H was notified and dispatched SRS along with their plant personnel to inspect the car and reported that the O-Ring on the magnetic gauge device had broken in two and that is what caused the release. The O-Ring was replaced and the car was cleaned of any residue.

item.title: Report I-2025010082
item.description:
Report I-2025010082

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-13T06:18:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-26
  • City: San Jose
  • State: RI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: AMERICAN AIRLINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 2
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: After the meal service I heard yelling and screaming and upon standing I saw sparks and flames shooting into the air over seat 1 F in all directions. The pax in 1 F was charging her iPhone with her own Anker power bank which apparently exploded into flames and sparks in her lap. She stood up and the power bank was on the carpet in front of the seat in flames and shooting sparks. I immediately notified the cockpit and crew and donned the PBE and used the halon in F class to extinguish the flames. The battery continued to smolder and hiss. The#2 brought up the containment bag and other halons and eq and I placed the smoldering device in the bag following the procedures on the bag. 8L of water were used. The cord was burned as well as the pax blouse and napkin. The passenger's left hand was burned as well her wrist. The#2 applied the burn gel and I bandaged her hand and wrist. Blistering was appearing on her wrist and pax requested and was given a small bag of ice as well. Pax denied medical assistance on the ground but plane was met by medics staff and Pax went with them. Bag was contained in an empty cart in F class and monitored for the flight. No further incidence was noted. Pax took her own anti inflammatory medicine and stated she was staying in SJO with 2 doctors. Battery was an Anker power bank 10,000. It was not plugged into the seat but was plugged into and changing her phone inflight. Pax thanked the crew profusely for our quick handling of the situation. Smoke filled the cabin but dissipated within about 30 minutes. The smell in F class remained however. Several passengers were coughing and had burning eyes as a result. Crew seems ok. I sustained slight bums on right and left hand from the sparks and have a sore throat and burning eyes.

item.title: Report I-2025010012
item.description:
Report I-2025010012

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-13T06:18:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-12
  • City: INDEPENDENCE
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: STG LOGISTICS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: While travelling, a vehicle accident caused truck to overturn off Highway 55 southbound just before Exit 40 in Independence, Louisiana. As a result, the freight shifted inside trailer, which resulted in the loss of less than 10 gallons of Nitromethane. The Louisiana State Police and Local Fire Department responded to assess the site. Clean Harbors Environmental Services was dispatched to perform the cleanup. Upon arrival on site, a minimal amount of free product was detected on the ground surface, which had been contained to immediate area. Gaines Wrecker Service uprighted the intermodal container /trailer and shipment was repositioned inside trailer for transport off Highway 55 to secure location nearby for transload. Louisiana State Police escorted Gaines Wrecker Service, along with recovered trailer, to 12392 LA 40 in Independence, Louisiana for transload. Clean Harbors Environmental Services recovered spent boom and absorbent material used to contain beneath overturned trailer, and hand shoveled a minimal amount of impacted soil from the area. Three 55- gallon drums of spent absorbents, boom, contaminated soil, and cleanup debris were generated during cleanup efforts. Clean Harbors Environmental Services then proceeded to transload the damaged drums onto a recovery trailer for transport to Gaines Wrecker Service at 12330 Louisiana Avenue in Roseland, Louisiana. Upon arrival at Gaines Wrecker Service, Clean Harbors Environmental Services overpacked the damaged drums, which were loaded back onto the recovery trailer, pending disposition. The shipment contained eighty (80) 55-gallon drums, of which eight (8) 55-gallon drums were discovered leaking from broken seams/pinhole cracks. The entire shipment had been damaged, and all eighty 55-gallon drums, were overpacked to prevent further incident.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On February 7, 2025, one (1) 55-gallon drum of printing ink was punctured and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Republic Services (RS) to remediate the site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the site. RS personnel dismantled the impacted pallet as well. All waste was containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum. The damaged drum was containerized in one (1) 85-gallon drum.

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-10T06:19:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-05
  • City: COLOGNE
  • State:
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AT THE UPS FACILITY IN COLOGNE, GERMANY, ONE AIR PACKAGE FROM USA TO GERMANY WAS FOUND SOILED WITH A VERY STRONG ODOR. THE PACKAGE HAS AN EXCEPTED QUANTITY MARK APPLIED TO THE PACKAGE WITH CLASSES INDICATED AS 3, 4.1, 6.1, 8, AND 9. CONTENT INSPECTION REVEALS MULTIPLE GLASS BOTTLES INSIDE WITH SEVERAL SHATTERED AND LEAKING. SEVEN GLASS BOTTLES ARE 500 ML SIZE EACH. SIXTEEN GLASS BOTTLES ARE 30 ML EACH. THE REGULATED CONTENTS INSIDE THE BOX ARE EXCEPTED QUANTITIES OF MATERIALS CLASSIFIED AS UN2874, FURFURYL ALCOHOL, 6.1, PG III, UN3265 CORROSIVE LIQUID ACIDIC ORGANOS NOS, CLASS 8, PG III, UN1224 KETONES LIQUID NOS, CLASS 3, PG III, UN1325 FLAMMABLE SOLIDS ORGANIC NOS, CLASS 4.1, PG III, AND UN1197 EXTRACTS FLAVORING LIQUID, CLASS 3, PG II. THERE ARE ADDITIONAL CHEMICALS INSIDE THE BOX THAT ARE NOT REGULATED IN TRANSPORTATION. THE PACKAGE AND CONTENTS WILL BE DISPOSED OF.

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: On February 3, 2025, one (1) 330-gallon tote of phosphoric acid was punctured and released approximately 330-gallons of product to the asphalt pavement and nearby storm drain. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. TLE personnel noted that the product released into a storm drain onsite and began utilizing a vacuum trailer to remove the liquids at each storm drain between the terminal building and the retention pond. All acid impacted liquids were collected and containerized into three (3) 330-gallon totes and one (1) 275-gallon tote and staged onsite for further management.

  • Description: On January 29, 2025, a Veolia employee was loading drums into a trailer at Eurofins. The employee used a drum dolly to move the 55 gallon plastic drum into the trailer. Once the employee placed the drum dolly down, the side of the drum cracked and started to spill. Approximately 2 gallons of liquid spilled from the drum. The drum was immediately leaned on its side to prevent additional liquid from spilling. A pump was used to transfer the contents of the leaking drum into a new drum for transportation. The spill was cleaned with absorbent.
